intro: Linosyris grimmii, commonly known as the Grimm's linseed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant is adapted to hot, dry environments and has a deep root system to access water. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Linosyris grimmii is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare and specialized species.
